data.title: The weather in January in Russia
data.meta_description: The average weather for the month of January in Russia. Read about the average temperatures and rainfall in Russia for January.
data.text:
Normal weather for Russia in January

It's cold in January in Russia with an average temperature of -5°C. Temperatures this month range from a low of -8°C to a high of -2°C. At night, you can expect temperatures between -14°C and -6°C.

In January, there is an average of 45 mm of precipitation, spread over 21 days days. Of the total precipitation, about 43 cm falls as snow in January. The wind speed is around 4 Bft, mostly coming from the South.

The UV index is a maximum of 2 this month. That's a low value on the intensity scale of 1 to 11. The risk of sunburn is minimal at this time.

The highest recorded temperature on January in recent years was 6°C in 2023. The lowest daytime temperature on this day was -29°C in 2020. The extreme night temperatures ranged from a low of -36°C to a high of 2°C.

Daily Temperature in January in Russia

This chart shows the average daily high temperatures in January in Russia, measured in degrees Celsius. The bottom of the chart shows the days of January. Based on historical data, it shows the average daily temperatures for this month.

Daily Rainfall in January in Russia

This chart shows the average daily rainfall in January for Russia, measured in millimetres over the past years. Rainfall is always measured as water, even if it’s snow or hail. The bottom of the chart shows the days of January. Based on historical data, this chart gives an idea of how much rain you can expect each day.

Daily Snowfall in January in Russia

This chart shows the average daily snowfall in January in Russia, measured in centimetres. The bottom of the chart shows the days of the month. The data is based on historical measurements and gives an idea of the average snowfall in January.

Daily UV Index in January in Russia

This chart shows the average daily UV index in January in Russia, with the UV index ranging from 0 to a maximum of 11. The bottom of the chart shows the days of the month. Based on historical data, this chart provides an idea of the daily UV radiation levels you can expect.

Temperature in January in Russia Over the Years

This chart shows the average temperature in January in Russia, measured in degrees Celsius, over the past years.

Total Rainfall in January in Russia Over the Years

This chart shows the average rainfall in January in Russia, measured in millimetres over the past years. Rainfall is always measured as water, even if it’s snow or hail.

Snowfall in January in Russia per year

This chart shows the average snowfall in January in Russia, measured in centimetres, over the past years.
